page.title: 15HOUSING IN PLASMARL, SWANSEA
page.content:
Plasmarl is made up mainly of terraced houses all neatly standing row by row. They are quite old, made of stone with slate-tiled roofs. Many people are now having extensions built to their properties to make them larger. They are also brightening them up with paint or pebbledash and new front doors and windows (mainly double glazing).
Most houses have no front gardens but usually have a big back garden in which the old outside toilet stands. Most of the houses are built on the hillside, with steep roads leading up to them.
Newer houses are built on the outskirts of Plasmarl, most of them bungalows.
